title: VA NEWS | Exploring the US Army 250th Exhibit
summary:

Discover the "Call to Arms: The Soldier and the Revolutionary War" exhibit, featuring rare artifacts and interactive displays that bring the story of America's first soldiers to life. Learn about the origins of duty and sacrifice that still define the mission today. Admission to the museum is free, especially for Veterans and their families. For more information, visit: National Museum of the U.S. Army.

Thank you for watching and most of all, thank you for your service! #VANews #Veterans #USArmy250 #ArmyHistory #USArmyMuseum #VeteranSupport

title: Telestroke - Sleep Apnea
summary:
Sleep Apnea is a serious medical issue where breathing repeatedly stops during sleep. When that happens, oxygen levels drop, blood pressure rises, and over time, risk of stroke increases. Sleep apnea can be treated and doing so can help one sleep better, feel better, and lower their risk of stroke.

Stroke education video for Veterans and their caregivers. Produced by the Department of Veterans Affairs for the VA National Telestroke Program, Dr Robert Trainor, Telestroke Neurologist, describes the medical condition of Sleep Apnea and how it impacts patients and may lead to a stroke. 

#Telestroke #SleepApnea #ObstructedSleepApnea

title: Telestroke - Signs and Symptoms
summary:
A stroke happens when blood flow to the brain is interrupted by a clot or a burst blood vessel. Without oxygen, brain cells begin to die within minutes. In fact, during an ischemic stroke—the most common type—about 2 million brain cells die every minute until blood flow is restored. Knowing the warning signs and acting quickly can save your life—or the life of someone you care about. Knowing the warning signs and acting quickly can save your life—or the life of someone you care about. 

Stroke education video for Veterans and their caregivers. Produced by the Department of Veterans Affairs for the VA National Telestroke Program, Dr Robert Trainor, Telestroke Neurologist, describes the medical condition of Cholesterol and how it impacts patients and may lead to a stroke.

 #Telestroke #SignsandSymptoms #Stroke

Steel Knight is an annual exercise that strengthens the Navy–Marine Corps team’s ability to respond forward, integrate across domains and sustain Marine Air-Ground Task Force readiness.

title: Business Regulation and Business Starts in California

A new report examines how California measures up against other states in the number and restrictive nature of regulations, with a focus on understanding the effects on business launches.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Policy Brief: Business Regulation and Business Starts in California
summary: California is seen as more regulated than other states, and many see regulations as dampening the business climate. While California does not stand out for its number of business regulations, it does stand out for its number of regulatory constraints.

title: Assessment of CSU’s Graduation Initiative 2025
summary: This report focuses on the California State University’s (CSU’s) Graduation Initiative 2025 (GI 2025). This initiative aimed to increase graduation rates and close gaps in graduation rates among particular student groups by 2025. In the report, we provide background on GI 2025, then discuss associated funding and activities. Next, we analyze the outcomes and assess the benefits and drawbacks of GI 2025. Lastly, we make recommendations for the Legislature to consider as it contemplates its involvement in CSU’s next graduation initiative.

title: Assessment of the Strong Workforce Program
summary: This report focuses on the Strong Workforce Program, which the state created to increase the availability and quality of career technical education at the California Community Colleges. We provide background on the program, assess its implementation and outcomes, and raise a few issues to consider relating to coordination of workforce development programs more broadly.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Updating California’s School Funding Formula: Assessing Alternatives and Trade-Offs
summary: California’s school funding formula has boosted funding for high-need students and increased district autonomy. While student outcomes have improved, schools still face fiscal and academic challenges. This report examines how tweaks to the funding system could affect state spending and district allocations, highlighting the trade-offs involved.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Policy Brief: Updating California’s School Funding Formula
summary: We model the state’s school funding system and consider several distinct changes, ranging in cost from $1.5 to $3.8 billion, that could address ongoing challenges. Each change leads to different funding levels across districts and student groups.

title: PPIC Statewide Survey: Californians and Their Government
summary: Key findings of the latest survey include: More than seven in ten Californians expect bad economic times in the state and nation in the coming year. Two in three say housing affordability is a big problem in their part of the state, and most are less comfortable making a major purchase than they were six months ago. A majority of likely voters say they are more enthusiastic than usual about voting next November.

title: Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California
summary:
Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California

In this episode, we delve into the staggering fraud and corruption that has taken hold in Minnesota and California. We examine how dozens of individuals, predominantly from the East African and Somali communities, have been convicted of stealing over a billion dollars from taxpayer-funded programs during the COVID-19 pandemic. Governor Tim Walz's administration is under scrutiny for its failure to address this, allegedly due to fears of losing political support. We also explore similar issues in California, where illegal immigrants have fraudulently obtained commercial driver's licenses, leading to deadly accidents. This episode highlights the broader impacts of mass immigration and inadequate assimilation on the rule of law in the United States. 00:00 Massive COVID-19 Fraud in Minnesota 00:25 Governor's Response and Accountability 01:24 Political Implications and Media Coverage 02:13 Details of the Fraud Scandal 05:31 Broader Issues of Immigration and Multiculturalism 07:46 Specific Cases of Fraud and Corruption 19:50 Illegal Immigrants and Fraudulent Licenses 35:00 Conclusion and Final Thoughts

title: Red Alert: NYC's Radical Leftist Takeover
summary:

They discuss the implications of the new mayor's administration on law enforcement and the rule of law. Key topics include the incoming Chief of Staff's radical views, the goals of the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA), and the potential for revolutionary changes in policing policies. Is the future of New York City in jeopardy? How will these changes affect the everyday New Yorker?

Examining Non-Citizens as US Law Enforcement Officers

A Deep Dive Join us as we welcome back Mike Wood, author of 'Newhall Shooting: A Tactical Analysis.' We discuss the controversial topic of non-US citizens serving as peace officers across the country, with a focus on recent laws in California. Is this a necessary solution to manpower shortages or a dangerous precedent undermining US sovereignty and rule of law? Tune in as we delve into specific cases, legislative changes, and the broader implications for the law enforcement community and public safety.

title: Beyond Wokeness: A Call for True Leadership in Law Enforcement and Politics
summary:
Beyond Wokeness: A Call for True Leadership in Law Enforcement and Politics

With special guest Marc Gomez (Retired Sergeant CHP) we dive into the current state of leadership and its challenges. From the Attorney General candidate Jay Jones' scandal in Virginia to the controversial decision by Chicago PD's Chief of Patrol, we explore how politics influence critical decisions. We also examine Secretary of War Pete Hegseth's bold statements on restoring military standards and how this contrasts with the perceived lack of leadership in places like Chicago. How is leadership shaping the future of our institutions? Can we navigate through political influence to uphold professionalism and safety? Join the discussion and get the facts.

title: ABC7: California retired veterans and families to benefit from new military pension tax exemption
summary: REDLANDS, Calif. (KABC) — Veterans have served and sacrificed for our nation, and on Tuesday, the state of California announced a new law to help them in retirement. That law will exempt part of their military pensions from state income tax. At American Legion Post 106 in Redlands, Assemblymember James Ramos (D-San Bernardino) stood before retired […]

title: PRESS RELEASE: Senate Judiciary Kicks Can Down the Road on Protecting Veterans from Claim Sharks
summary: For Immediate Release 9/9/25 Contact: Meghan Callahan, mc@callahanpa.com Today, California’s Senate Judiciary Committee chose to kick the can down the road and delay enacting needed protections for veterans from claim sharks. Rather than voting up or down on SB 694, they voted to send the bill to rules where the bill’s fate is uncertain.  SB […]
